required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Progranulin and FAM19A5 Protein Blood Levels in Metabolic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Progranulin and Chemokine-like Protein TAFA-5 (FAM19A5) Blood Levels in Adults With Metabolic Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of the study is to assess the serum levels of progranulin and FAM19A5 protein in adults with metabolic syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is planned to be conducted on 40 adults with metabolic syndrome. As a control, it is planned to recruit 40 adults without metabolic syndrome. From all participants fasting venous blood samples, urine samples and hair samples will be collected. Next, serum progranulin and serum FAM19A5 protein concentrations will be determined in both groups. Also, serum concentration of leptin, vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF), insulin, neopterin, adropin and selected cytokines, adipokines, myokines and chemokines, total cholesterol, low-density lipoproteins, high-density lipoproteins, triglycerides and glucose will be determined. Serum, hair and urine mineral content will be determined. In whole blood genetic analyses will be performed in order to detect and examine progranulin and FAM19A5 genes, and genes associated with the development of metabolic syndrome and genes associated with the body's mineral metabolism. Also, body composition analysis, blood pressure measurement, pulse measurement, blood oxygen saturation measurement and nutritional interview will be performed.

primary_outcome.description: Concentration of FAM19A5 protein in serum

secondary_outcome.description: Detection and testing of progranulin genes
Detection and testing of FAM19A5 protein genes
The content of iron will be determined in hair (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of zinc will be determined in hair (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of copper will be determined in hair (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of iron will be determined in serum (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of zinc will be determined in serum (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of copper will be determined in serum (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of iron will be determined in urine (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of zinc will be determined in urine (atomic absorption spectrometry)
The content of copper will be determined in urine (atomic absorption spectrometry)
Measurement of blood oxygen level- measured non-invasively with the use of oximeter
Blood concentration of low density lipoprotein (LDL)
Blood concentration of high density lipoprotein (HDL)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group A - study group - patients with metabolic syndrome
arm_group.description: Patients with metabolic syndrome will be included. Procedures: blood sample collection hair sample collection urine sample collection body composition analysis questionnaires blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen saturation measurement

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group B - control group - patients without metabolic syndrome
arm_group.description: Patients without metabolic syndrome will be included. blood sample collection hair sample collection urine sample collection body composition analysis questionnaires blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen saturation measurement

intervention.description: Fasting blood sample will be collected from forearm vein. In the sample the concentration of: progranulin and serum FAM19A5 protein, leptin, VEGF, insulin, neopterin, adropin and selected cytokines, adipokines, myokines and chemokines, total cholesterol, low-density lipoproteins, high-density lipoproteins, triglycerides and glucose will be determined. Whole blood sample will be secured to isolate genetic material, detect and examine progranulin and FAM19A5 genes, and genes associated with the development of metabolic syndrome and with the body's mineral management. Serum mineral analysis will be performed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group A - study group - patients with metabolic syndrome
Group B - control group - patients without metabolic syndrome

intervention.description: Hair sample collection will be performed. Hair mineral analysis will be performed.

Group B - control group - patients without metabolic syndrome

intervention.description: Urine sample collection will be performed. Urine mineral analysis will be performed.

intervention.description: Body composition analysis with the use of electric bioimpedance will be performed.

intervention.description: Dietary and lifestyle interview with the use of dietary and lifestyle questionnaires and dietary diaries will be performed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group A - study group - patients with metabolic syndrome
Group B - control group - patients without metabolic syndrome

intervention.intervention_name: Blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen saturation measurement
intervention.description: Blood pressure, pulse and blood oxygen saturation measurements with the use of non-invasive methods will be performed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group A - study group - patients with metabolic syndrome
Group B - control group - patients without metabolic syndrome

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples of blood, hair and urine will be collected. From whole-blood samples of serum and plasma will be determined. From whole-blood genetic material will be isolated. Samples of serum, plasma, whole-blood, urine and serum will be signed with patient's unique code preventing patient's data identification. Only study team will have access to samples.

study_pop.textblock: 40 people (women and men) with metabolic syndrome (study group) and 40 people (women and men) without metabolic syndrome (control group).
